dt: {bc}a predominantly fawn-colored Old World bird ({it}Garrulus glandarius{/it}) of the crow family with a black-and-white crest and wings marked with black, white, and blue
{bc}any of various usually crested and largely blue chiefly New World birds that are related to the common Old World jay and have roving habits and harsh voices {dx}compare {dxt|blue jay||}{/dx}

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Late Latin {it}gaius{/it}
shortdef: a predominantly fawn-colored Old World bird (Garrulus glandarius) of the crow family with a black-and-white crest and wings marked with black, white, and blue
any of various usually crested and largely blue chiefly New World birds that are related to the common Old World jay and have roving habits and harsh voices

dt: {bc}a crested bright blue North American jay ({it}Cyanocitta cristata{/it})

shortdef: a crested bright blue North American jay (Cyanocitta cristata)

dt: {bc}a jay ({it}Cyanocitta stelleri{/it}) of western North America with a high crest and black and dark blue plumage

shortdef: a jay (Cyanocitta stelleri) of western North America with a high crest and black and dark blue plumage
